meanings.definition: An increase in speed or rate of progress.
meanings.sent1: The speedups in our internet connection have made streaming movies much easier.
meanings.sent2: The speedups in the production line have led to higher efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The speedups in the snail race were quite unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her energy drink acted like speedups for her tired body.
meanings.sent5: The speedups in the car engine made it roar like a lion.

meanings.definition: The act of making something go faster.
meanings.sent1: He used special tools to create speedups in his bicycle.
meanings.sent2: The speedups in the marathon were due to the athletes' determination.
meanings.sent3: The speedups in the turtle race caused quite a stir among the spectators.
meanings.sent4: The wind acted as speedups for the sailing boat.
meanings.sent5: The speedups in the rocket launch were exhilarating to watch.

meanings.definition: A process or technique that makes something happen more quickly.
meanings.sent1: The new software includes speedups for data processing.
meanings.sent2: The speedups in the cooking method reduced the preparation time significantly.
meanings.sent3: Using a magic wand for speedups in chores seemed like a fun idea.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like speedups for brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The speedups in the growth of plants after rain are truly remarkable.
